abstract_summ: The 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19) presents a great challenge to developing countries with limited access to public health measures in grassroots communities.We draw on Taiwan’s SARS experience to argue that a modified form of Traffic Control Bundling protects health care worker safety and by extension strengthens overall COVID-19 epidemic control.• While all activities surrounding alcohol is banned in Iran, mass methanol poisoning outbreaks (such as the one amid the COVID-19 epidemic with more than 5,000 poisonings and more than 700 deaths within only two months) have become a major public health concern.This short communication presents cases that could benchmark public health policies in developing countries.Novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19), named a pandemic by the WHO, is the current global health crisis.
title_summ: A Syndemic of COVID-19 and methanol poisoning in Iran: Time for Iran to consider alcohol use as a public health challenge?Tribute to health workers in China: A group of respectable population during the outbreak of the COVID-19All together to Fight COVID-19A Hidden Key to COVID-19 Management in Korea: Public Health DoctorsProtecting Health Care Workers during the COVID-19 Coronavirus Outbreak –Lessons from Taiwan's SARS responseVietnamese Public Health Practices in the Advent of the COVID-19 Pandemic: Lessons for Developing CountriesPerspectives on the death investigation during the COVID-19 pandemicStrengthening the Power of Nurses in Combating COVID‐19
title_abstract_phrases: Protecting Health Care Workers during the COVID-19 Coronavirus Outbreak –Lessons from Taiwan's SARS responseDuring major epidemic outbreaks, demand for health care workers grows even as the extreme pressures they face cause declining availability.Tribute to health workers in China: A group of respectable population during the outbreak of the COVID-19The health authorities reported that 3,019 Chinese health workers were infected with the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), of whom, ten died.We draw on Taiwan’s SARS experience to argue that a modified form of Traffic Control Bundling protects health care worker safety and by extension strengthens overall COVID-19 epidemic control.Vietnamese Public Health Practices in the Advent of the COVID-19 Pandemic: Lessons for Developing CountriesThe 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19) presents a great challenge to developing countries with limited access to public health measures in grassroots communities.A Hidden Key to COVID-19 Management in Korea: Public Health DoctorsPublic health doctors of Korea contributed significantly to massive coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) testing.
